titleStmt.title: Sad news from Salisbury, and other parts of the west of England. Being an account of a most sad and dreadful frost and snow, which hapned on the 23d. of December 1684. in and about most parts of the west of England, which froze to death many poor passengers who travelled the rode, besides many beasts, incredible to believe, but that some who were in the same storm are alive to justify the truth thereof ... To the tune of, Aim not too high.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
